channel.title: Port forwarding problem
channel.description: ummm well i am trying to port forward be fore i have someone host it but i really want to host it from my computer but if i cant ok but i have an verizon wireless router and i have tryed serval diffetn users names and passwords(admin,admin - admin,blank - blank,admin - blank,blank) and i cant seem to acess any settings for my router cuase i cant figure out the password so would anyone help post if you can please and thanks :P

ok basically if you did that it well knock off the passwords that have been added to your router, and it well reset one connection, so then you have two. You can get rid of one. Only problem is when your parents want to get into router they see their is no more password or they well not know what it is if its admin

item.title: Port forwarding problem
item.dc:creator: @darkgama13 darkgama13
item.description:
@darkgama13 wrote:

[quote=“moparRuler, post:4, topic:220173”][quote author=Mod Foxen link=topic=289155.msg2335052#msg2335052 date=1216060767]
Well… Are you the acctual owner of that computer?
[/quote]

wat? its a router… not computer

Ok here is a way to fix your problem their should be a little button on the back of router or little hole wat not, hold it for a while this well reset your router to default factory settings illiminating the anoying password

Then to make the no-ip go to no-ip.com make acc , then add host, , once that is done go to done go to downloads and download then login and click ur host box check.

Then go into router , then gaming or w/e. then portforwarding find ur ip which can be done by going to comand prompt

then ipconfig then add the last 3 digits. and make sure u put ur port for start and stop and name it w/e u like.

hope helps[/quote]

ok thing is if i reset the router ummm really i am just screwd cuase i will be getting emails and stufff to shut down the router cuase i think i am not completely sure but i basicly have completely free internet

Read full topic

item.title: Port forwarding problem
item.dc:creator: @moparRuler moparRuler
item.description:
@moparRuler wrote:

Mod Foxen:

Well… Are you the acctual owner of that computer?

wat? its a router… not computer

Ok here is a way to fix your problem their should be a little button on the back of router or little hole wat not, hold it for a while this well reset your router to default factory settings illiminating the anoying password

Then to make the no-ip go to no-ip.com make acc , then add host, , once that is done go to done go to downloads and download then login and click ur host box check.

Then go into router , then gaming or w/e. then portforwarding find ur ip which can be done by going to comand prompt

then ipconfig then add the last 3 digits. and make sure u put ur port for start and stop and name it w/e u like.

hope helps

Read full topic
